text.section:
An officer or employee of a corporation may practice engineering without a license if:
the corporation is engaged in research and development engineering for the federal government; and
the work of the officer or employee relates to that research and development engineering.

An officer or employee of a corporation may practice engineering without a license if:
the corporation is engaged in:
manufacturing;
industrial processes;
industrial engineering; or
maintenance and repair of structures or equipment used in industrial processes or manufacturing; and
the work of the officer or employee relates to the products or systems of the corporation or its subsidiaries or affiliates.
An officer or employee of a corporation may practice engineering under this section only as the practice relates to the officer's or employee's work for the corporation.
